string.text: Do you really want to leave the ZONE?
Press ($$ACTION_JUMP$$) to go to the main menu
Loading the game will result in the loss of unsaved data. Would you like to continue?
The version of the saved game does not match or the saved game is corrupted.
Do you really want to delete the file?
Press any key to go to the game
A file with this name already exists. Overwrite it?
Are you sure you want to quit the game?
Are you sure you want to exit to Windows?
Do not pause when switching to other windows
Changes will take effect only after game restart
Click the 'Advanced' button to change the settings added to OGSR
Hover your mouse over the option and see its description here. This way you will be able to understand the meaning of unfamiliar settings, as well as new settings added to OGSR
The effect of dof when reloading
The effect of dof when aiming
Quality of eye focus effect (r2 dof)
Ambient Music (requires reloading the current location to take effect)
Require key press upon loading the game
Switching the slot using the mouse wheel
The density of the grass - r__detail_density
The range of drawing grass - r__detail_radius
The shadow from the sun - r2_sun
The clarity of textures at a distance - r__tf_mipbias
The angle of shadow rendering - r2_sun_near_border
The intensity of the HDR - r2_tonemap_middlegray
The brightness of the light of the sun - r2_sun_lumscale
The soft edge of the water - r2_soft_water
Intensity of pre-calculated global illumination - r2_ao_intensity
The focusing effect of the eye - r2_dof_enable
The effect of dof when reloading - r2_dof_reload
The effect of depth of the scene when aiming - g_dof_zoom
The quality of the focusing effect of the eye - r2_dof_quality
Reflections in water and puddles - r_sslr_enable
The sharpness of the image - r2_image_sharpening
Shadow of the main character - r__actor_shadow
The range of the sun - r2_sun_far
Reflections on the edges of the helmet - r2_visor_refl
MSAA is a very heavy and at the same time very high quality type of anti-aliasing. Qualitatively smoothes wires, vegetation, translucent geometry.

This setting adjusts the amount by which the visibility limit set in the current weather profile is multiplied. The range of values of this value is from 0.4 (minimum slider) to 1.5 (maximum slider). For example, in the weather, a viewing range of 150 meters is set. At the minimum of the slider you will see at 60 meters, at the maximum at 225. High viewing range can greatly reduce the performance of older PCs.
This setting adjusts the detail of drawing and lighting models of people, monsters, and weapons in the game. The further the slider is, the more detailed they will be.

This setting controls how tightly the grass bushes are drawn in the game. The further the slider is, the closer the grass elements will be drawn to each other and the thicker it will be. ATTENTION! Excessive density of grass leads to strong brakes, if you want to adjust this parameter, do it a little, each time checking what happened.

This setting adjusts the maximum distance at which the grass is drawn. The farther the slider is, the farther the grass edge will be. The slider allows you to adjust the distance in the range from 48 (standard range) to 240 meters. ATTENTION! The algorithm for drawing grass by the game is such that when the radius of the grass increases, the load on the video card increases in geometric progression. More or less acceptable values lie within 150-200 meters (the middle of the slider).

This setting allows you to enable an optimized grass rendering mode due to its 'thinning' over long distances. Allows you to win several fps with large values of the drawing distance and grass density.

This setting adjusts the level of detail of textures in the game. The farther the slider is, the more distinct the textures are and the more video memory they require. When this setting is lowered, textures will blur, but therefore consume less memory.

This setting controls the degree of anisotropic texture filtering. The minimum value of the slider corresponds to a single filter, the maximum value corresponds to a hexadecimal filter. The higher it is, the clearer the textures will look with increasing distance to them.
This setting includes bullet marks on bodies.
This setting adjusts the quality of the game engine's full-screen anti-aliasing effect on static lighting.
This setting enables objects to cast shadows from sunlight. On weak PCs, disabling this setting can give a serious speed boost.

This setting enables the grass to cast shadows from sunlight and other dynamic lighting sources. Now this setting works - we fixed it. ATTENTION! Setting up just sucks the hell out of performance. Don't use it with a large grass rendering radius or high grass density!
This setting adjusts the accuracy of the lighting calculation as the distance to them increases. The higher it is, the more detailed the shadows from dynamic light sources will look at a distance.

This option allows the game to process the volumetric light from NPC flashlights. On slower hardware, disabling this setting may provide a noticeable performance boost at nighttime when in camps with lots of NPCs.
This setting adjusts the quality of drawing shadows in the game. The higher it is, the smoother the edges of the shadows will be.

This setting allows you to enable vertical synchronization, i.e. synchronization of the frame rate with the refresh rate of the monitor. When turned on, the effect of a small horizontal displacement of parts of the screen with sharp mouse movements will disappear, but performance may decrease slightly.

This setting causes the game to always use a video mode with a screen refresh rate of 60 Hertz. This setting is useful for owners of monitors whose game does not correctly determine the refresh rate of the screen when running. However, it is recommended to enable this setting only if you have such a problem. In some rare cases, enabling this setting may cause lags in full-screen mode.
This setting enables shader smoothing on dynamic lighting.
This setting switches the anti-aliasing type on dynamic lighting. Available SMAA (Subpixel Morphological antialiasing).

This setting adjusts the detail of mip levels of textures at a distance. The normal value of this slider is average, and when you reduce it, the textures at a distance will be less clear, when you increase them-more clear, but excessive magnification can lead to the appearance of moire and unpleasant flickering dots on distant objects.

This setting adjusts the degree of reflection of light on shiny and matte surfaces such as metal, leather, wood, etc. This is an"amateur" setting, and if you don't know exactly what you're doing, leave it at the default value. The further the slider is, the stronger the reflection effect, but do not overdo it - at large values, the surfaces begin to look like they are covered in plastic.

This setting adjusts the distance to which dynamic shadows are drawn in full quality. Above this distance, they begin to blur and the quality of their rendering decreases, as the shadow calculation switches to simplified mode. The slider adjusts the value in the range from 1 to 60 meters. Configure the parameter together with the shadow resolution (in the configurator). The more you set the slider, the more you should set the resolution of the shadow map for good quality.

This setting adjusts the viewing angle at which shadows are normally drawn. If this angle is not sufficient, extra triangular shadows will be constantly visible at the edges of the screen. It is recommended to keep the setting at maximum.
This effect may not look good on all ground textures because correct heightmaps are required for all ground textures.

This setting enables the HDR Tone mapping effect. It improves the image by accentuating details that would not be sufficiently contrasting without this effect - small elements, edges, while not making the image excessively bright.

This setting adjusts the intensity of the HDR Tone mapping effect. ATTENTION! This is an"amateur" setting, and if you don't know exactly what you're doing, leave it at the default value. Adjust in small steps, because at excessive values of this setting, the image becomes surreal, and the illuminated areas are overexposed. If you lift it too high, you will get an HDR effect reminiscent of Fallout 3.
This setting adjusts the intensity of sunlight. The higher it is, the brighter the sunlit areas will be and the deeper the shadows will be.

This setting adjusts the intensity of ambient light independent of the sun. The higher it is, the lighter all the shaded areas in the game will be, and the paler the shadows from the sun will look. ATTENTION! This is an"amateur" setting, and if you don't know exactly what you're doing, leave it at the default value. Boost if the overall game seems too dark to you and you can't achieve the desired effect with the brightness/contrast sliders. It is not recommended to lift up too much - the image will lose its volume, it will look flatter.
This setting adjusts the rendering of volumetric (more often solar) rays on dust in the air.

This setting switches the type of volumetric beams. You can choose the option from Crysis or the option from STALKER: Clear Sky. ATTENTION! Volumetric rays from a clear Sky can significantly reduce performance.

This setting includes the effect of softening the edge of water surfaces. When it is turned on, the water at the edge of reservoirs will gradually gain transparency up to complete invisibility, which eliminates the effect of a sharp and highly noticeable border between water and land.

This setting includes a soft particle effect. When you turn it on, the appearance of such effects as fire, smoke, explosions, sparks, etc. will greatly improve. It is recommended to always keep this setting enabled.
This setting adjusts the effect of softening the edges of shadows in the game, with it the shadows look more realistic.
This setting adjusts the effect of softening the shadows from the lamps with the distance from the lamp. Shadows look more realistic.

This setting enables pre-calculated global lighting in the game. At the same time, ready-made hemi-lightmaps are used, which allow you to bring the image closer to photorealism. When this setting is enabled, the interior of the premises will become noticeably darker. The setting does not affect the performance, since the effect is calculated in advance, but keep in mind that the effects of pre - calculated global lighting and dynamic-r2_ssao, overlap. Accordingly, if you want to use both effects, it makes sense to lower the strength of the effect of both, so as not to get an unnecessarily dark image. Or, if speed is important to you, use only pre-calculated lighting, and disable dynamic global lighting.
This setting adjusts the intensity of the pre-calculated global lighting in the game. Higher values allow you to get a more realistic picture, but lead to a darkening of the scene.

This setting enables global lighting mode in the game. This effect, when enabled, calculates areas that are additionally shaded by the model geometry, making the lighting more similar to that in the real world, with partial shadows and shading from equipment elements, clothing, machine parts, grass, and other small parts of the geometry.
This setting adjusts the mode of operation of the global lighting effect in the game.

This setting adjusts the effect of improved surface relief using the Steep parallax mapping algorithm. This algorithm uses ray tracing in the space of the elevation map to calculate the relief, which gives a more realistic and high-quality effect.
This setting includes a component of the depth - of-field effect - real-time eye focus. Some people find it annoying, so we left the option to turn it off.
This setting includes a component of the depth - of-field effect - focusing the eyes on the weapon when reloading.
This setting includes a component of the depth of view effect - blurring the edges of the screen when aiming.
This setting adjusts the quality of the depth-of-field effect.
This setting includes Detailed Terrain-displaying small details and roughness on objects.
Turning on flares from light bulbs.
The setup includes a simulated 'dirt' on the lens of the camera lens.
This setting includes the appearance of drops on the glass of helmets and gas masks during rain.
The setting includes dynamic puddles that appear during rain.
The setting enables surfaces to get wet when it rains.
The setting includes surround light for some lamps.
This setting enables reflections on the water and in puddles during rain.
Tessellation increases the quality of low-polygonal models of NPS, monsters, hands of the actor, animated objects (bottles, etc.). The angular models become more smoothed.
This setting enables shader optimization mode. Allows you to raise the FPS on video cards with a narrow bus or low memory bandwidth.

Setting allows you to adjust the sharpness of the image. ATTENTION! This is a setting from the category \"for an amateur\", and SHOULD NORMALLY BE DISABLED. Include ONLY if you are a fan of granular images. At high values, it gives a noticeable halo around objects.
The setup includes a surround of the fog. It is used to simulate muddy water, haze in lowlands, and similar effects.
Adjusts the range of the sun. With this setting, you can win some FPS in sunny weather. You can reduce it, for example, by half. The picture will not change much, and the FPS will be higher.

The higher the resolution of the shadow maps , the clearer the shadows will be in the distance (more than ~15-20 meters from the GG-beyond the border of the near cascade of shadows). To avoid a noticeable deterioration in the quality of shadows at this border, it is recommended to set the resolution at least 4096x4096. The setting has a big impact on performance.
Activates simultaneous loading of textures by multiple threads. It can slightly reduce the load time of the save if you have an SSD.

It makes sense to increase the viewing angle for wide monitors and depending on individual preferences. %c[red] \nThis setting is activated only after loading the game, because its value is saved in the save. Setting this option via console/user.ltx will not work. This is done specifically because of some features of the mod.

The player's viewing angle. If a value such as 0.45 or less (less in the middle of the slider), the weapon will be closer, if this is set to 0.65 or more (more the middle of the slider), the weapons in the game will appear on. It makes sense to individually configure for wide monitors and depending on the FOV. %c[red] \nThis setting is activated only after the game is loaded, like the fov setting!

This setting adjusts the intensity of hemi lighting. The higher it is, the lighter it will be. ATTENTION! This is an"amateur" setting, and if you don't know exactly what you're doing, leave it at the default value. Boost if the overall game seems too dark to you and you can't achieve the desired effect with the brightness/contrast sliders.
This setting controls which frame in turn will be rendered in the 3D scope. By default - every 2. If you increase it, the FPS in the game will increase, but the FPS in the 3D scope will decrease.
